passages.text: EQUITY:CONSUMER RELATED
Sales/earnings growth on track; increased shareholder returns a plus; maintain Buy

Haier announced its 2Q25 results (28 Aug) with solid readings from all major perspectives, in our view. Quarterly revenue increased \(10.4\%\) y- y to CNY77bn (1H24 revenue growth of \(10.2\%\) y- y), while quarterly earnings increased \(16.0\%\) y- y to CNY6.5bn (1H25 earnings growth of \(15.6\%\) y- y). Thanks to Haier's continued efforts to reduce costs/improve efficiency in the domestic market, along with its premium product positioning/integration of supply chain in the overseas markets, the company delivered a 1H25 gross margin of \(26.9\%\) (up 0.1pp y- y). Haier has further optimized its operations through digitalization, leading to a 0.1pp y- y improvement in its sales- cost ratio in 1H25 to \(10.1\%\) . Furthermore, Haier announced an interim DPS of CNY0.269, the first interim dividend of the company, indicating its strong commitment to shareholder returns, in our view. Haier's current FY25F dividend yield stands at a decent level of \(4.7\%\) . Haier, in our view, will maintain its solid sales/earnings growth in 2H25F despite headwinds from a fading impact of trade- in programs. We forecast the company's sales/earnings to increase by \(8\% /13\%\) y- y in FY25F. We maintain our Buy rating.

Haier has further strengthened its multi- brand strategy in the domestic market, with the sales of its premium brand 'Casarte' and younger- consumer- focused brand 'Leader' growing \(20\% + / 15\% +\) y- y in 1H25, outpacing the company's sales growth of \(8.8\%\) y- y. For the overseas market, despite the sector- wide weakness in the US/European markets (1H25 home appliances sales value was slightly up by \(0.5\% /0.4\%\) y- y), Haier has been able to gain market shares in these markets (sales up \(2.4\% /8.5\%\) y- y); it recorded even- faster growth in emerging markets (1H25 sales in South Asia/ASEAN/Middle East up by \(33\% /18\% /65\%\) y- y), leveraging its multi- brand and premiumization strategies.

We maintain our FY25- 27F revenue and earnings forecasts for Haier. We also maintain our target price of CNY37.60, based on a 16.5x target forward- 12- month P/E applied to our FY25F earnings/estimate. Our target price implies \(45\%\) upside potential. Haier currently trades at FY25F P/E of 10.5x (EPS: CNY2.28). Reiterate Buy.
Source:Company data,Nomura estimates

Haier is mainly engaged in the research, development, production and sales of smart home appliances such as refrigerators/freezers, washing machines, air conditioners, water heaters, kitchen appliances, small home appliances and smart home scene solutions.
Our target price of CNY37.60 is based on 16.5x FY25F P/E, which represents +1SD above Haier's historical average P/E of 13.0x since 2015. The benchmark index for this stock is CSI300.
Downside risks to our target price and Buy rating include higher commodity prices, intensifying price competition in home appliance sectors and further worsening of macroeconomic factors.

Haier is an SOE home appliance company with its headquarter in Qingdao, Shandong province. Haier's current chairman is Mr. Li Huagang. The biggest shareholder of Haier is Haier Group with \(27.8\%\) shareholding (as of end- June 2022). There are ten members on the board of Haier, with four being independent directors. Haier has: 1) actively cooperated with enterprises of upstream and downstream in industrial chain to achieve carbon reduction throughout the product life cycle, 2) continued to promote the sustainable development of the industrial chain, and 3) done continuous research of innovative technologies to improve product quality.
